level.ecm_name: Geothermal Heat Pump Generator with 15 kW nominal capacity
level.description: This technology uses the constant temperature of the earth as the exchange medium instead of the outside air temperature. Geothermal heat pump systems consist of three parts: the ground heat exchanger, the heat pump unit, and the air delivery system (ductwork). The heat exchanger is a system of pipes called a loop, which is buried in the shallow ground near the building. A fluid (usually water or a mixture of water and antifreeze) circulates through the pipes to absorb or relinquish heat within the ground. Geothermal heat pumps use much less energy than conventional heating systems, since they draw heat from the ground.

level.application: _Forced Air Heating and Cooling utilizing a water-to-air heat pump and conventional ductwork for conditioned air distribution. _Hydronic radiant floor heating utilizing a water-to-water heat pump. _Domestic hot water – Partial water heating through the desuperheater/hot water generator option, which can be installed on any of the various types of geothermal heat pumps, or full domestic water heating utilizing a water-to-water heat pump. _ Pool/spa water heating utilizing a water-to-water heat pump.
level.advantages: _No seasonal variation _Compatibility with both centralized and distributed energy generation _Resource availability in all world regions, particularly for direct use.
level.disadvantages: _High capital cost _Use of electricity for heat generation
level.links_to_barriers: _Legal classification of plot doesn't allow to intervene _Generation systems type

level.installation_data: The most critical issue in a geothermal system is the integration of the pipes in the ground. According to the ground properties, this installation process could be easy or very difficult. In fact, when the hardness of the terrain is very high, in many cases it will be impossible to install this type of technology.
level.maintenance_data: The main maintenance activities are directly related to the regulation of the heat pump and to the optimization of the distribution system.
